intro: Lesliegraecum bemarivoense, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Lesliegraecum bemarivoense is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
